div.head: Career Summary
div.p: Reinhold was a pupil of Jakob Epstein (piano), Otto Desoff, and Bruckner (composition) at the Vienna Conservatory (1868-74). He was professor of piano at the Vienna Conservatory from 1897 to 1924; in 1905 he is recorded as teaching in the piano Ausbildungsschule. According to Paul de Conne (who had also taught in the piano Ausbildungsschule), as reported by Schenker (OJ 8/3, [67]), Reinhold was due to retire from the Conservatory (by which time it bore the name Akademie f√ºr Musik und darstellende Kunst) in 1919, at the time that its President, Karl von Wiener, resigned.

div.head: Reinhold and Schenker
div.p: There is no known correspondence between Reinhold and Schenker.
